content: अभ्युदय {%<ab>a.</ab>%} Rising. --यः {@--1@} Rise(of heavenly bodies); sunrise. {@--2@} Rise, prosperity, good fortune, elevation, success; स्पृशंति नः स्वामिनमभ्युदयाः <ls>Ratn. 1</ls> success; भवो हि लोकाभ्युदयाय ताटृशां <ls>R. 3. 14</ls>; <ls>Ms. 3. 254</ls>; <ls>Bh. 2. 63</ls>; <ls>R. 12. 3</ls>, <ls>V. 5.</ls> {@--3@} A festival; any religious or festive celebration, festive occasion; °कालः joyous or festive occasion; <ls>Ś. 7</ls>; <ls>Ms. 9. 84.</ls> {@--4@} Beginning, commencement. {@--5@} Occurrence, happening. {@--6@} Accomplishment of a desired object (which is the cause of festivity). {@--7@} The {%tonsure%} ceremony. {@--8@} A Śrāddha performed on account of child-birth (वृद्धिश्राद्धं)
